result.execSummary:
The defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, surcharge waived in the interest of paying restitution in case 14CF1292.
Pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision in case 14CF1292. Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF1292.  May be served in WSP.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, voting.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction-may be served at WSP-this sentence is concurrent with 14CF1292.

The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--surcharge waived in the interest of paying restitution in case 14CF1292
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision in case 14CF1292; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Demarco Dashawn Lucas in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
dated 5/8/2014 from Defendant.  kmw
